div.l: I wele ryse ⁊and antere it be myn fay
Vn hardi is vn sely þus men say
And vp he ros ⁊and softely he wente
Vn to þe cradil ⁊and in hese hond it hente
And bar it softe vn to hese bedis feet
Sone aftyr þis þe wyf here routyng let
And gan to wake ⁊and lefte for to pysse
And cam a geyn ⁊and gan here cradil mysse
And gropede here ⁊and þ̉ere / but sche fond non
Allas ꝙquod sche I hadde almost mys gon
I hadde al most gon to þe clerkys bed
Ey benedyste þānne hadde I foule I sped
And forth sche goth tyl sche þe cradel fond
Sche gropede alwey ferþ̉ere wᵗith here hond
And fond þe bed ⁊and thouȝte not but good
Be cause þᵗat þe cradyl by it stod

l.hi: And nyste wher sche was for it was derk

div.l: And nyste where sche was for it was derk
And fayre ⁊and wel sche crep in bi þe clerk
And lyth ful stylle ⁊and wolde a cauȝt a slep
With inne a while þis Iohn vp lep
And on þis goode wif he leyth on sore
So merye a fit ne hadde sche ful ȝore
He prikyth harde ⁊and sore as he were mad
This ioly lyf han þese too klerkis lad
Tyl þᵗat þe fyrste kok be gan to synge
Aleyn wex wery in þᵉ dawenynge
For he hadde swonkȳn al þe longe nyȝt
And seyde farwel malyn swete wyȝt
The day is come I may no lengere byde
But euere more where so I go or ryde
I is þȳn owene clerk so haue I sel
Now dere leman ꝙquod sche go fare weel
But er þᵘou go on thyng I wele þe telle
Whān þᵗat þᵘou wēndyst hōmward be þe melle
